div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.style: text-align: left;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Fellow Texans,

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: We hope this email finds you healthy and safe. This is a challenging time for all Texans, but by working together, we will come out of this even stronger than before. The Governor's Economic Development & Tourism Office (EDT) and community partners continue to closely monitor the current situation and are working hard to provide you with the latest information, updates and resources.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Governor Greg Abbott has issued three new

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: to begin the process of reopening the state of Texas while revising hospital capacity and certain social distancing guidelines. Within the orders, select activities and services that pose minimal to no threat of spreading COVID-19 are allowed to reopen. In addition, the Governor has established the

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: —a team of nationally recognized medical experts and private and public leaders who will advise the Governor on safely and strategically reopening the state.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: I’m honored to be named to serve on the Governor’s Strike Force to Open Texas and to work with other business and industry leaders to inform the Governor on the best strategies to open our economy while protecting the health and safety of Texans.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: For more information on the Strike Force to Open Texas, visit our official

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: and explore the Special Advisory Group and the Strike Force Working Groups. Texans are invited to offer feedback using the "Contact" button on those webpages, which will send inquiries to the Strike Force. The Governor and the Strike Force will provide an additional update on April 27, 2020.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Also included in the Governor's Executive Order is a new "Retail-To-Go" model for Texas retailers. This model will allow retail outlets in Texas to reopen beginning Friday, April 24. Under this model, reopened establishments are required to deliver items to customer's cars, homes or other locations to minimize contact. Any retailers considering utilizing the "Retail-To-Go" model should review the following guidance located on the Texas Department of State Health Services' website:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

a.strong: COVID-19: Guidance for Employers, Employees, and Customers of Reopened Retail Services

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Feel free to contact our office if we can answer any questions regarding resources for Texas businesses. Please continue to stay safe, healthy and hopeful. And please continue to check in online at

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: or follow us on social media for the latest information and resources. For additional information on Texas’ response to COVID-19, visit

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Thank you all for your continued service to Texas!

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Stay safe and stay healthy!

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Economic Development & Tourism

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Office of Governor Greg Abbott

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: #TexasBizStrong

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: "President Trump has unveiled Guidelines for Opening Up America Again, a three-phased approach based on the advice of public health experts. These steps will help state and local officials when reopening their economies, getting people back to work, and continuing to protect American lives."

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Today, Judge Hicks' 4pm Daily Briefing will be with Kristi Hanley, Chief Quality Officer and Bill Dickinson Lab Director with Cogdell Memorial Hospital. View previous videos on the Scurry County Youtube Channel.

iframe.aria-label: YouTube Video, Scurry County Daily Covid Briefing

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

div.p: Judge Hicks' Daily Briefing with Tammy Quick of the Scurry County Senior Center. View previous videos on the Scurry County Youtube Channel.

iframe.aria-label: YouTube Video, Scurry County Covid Daily Briefing

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: In addition to an increase in testing availability, Cogdell Memorial Hospital is now performing COVID-19 testing on patients who are admitted to the hospital and all Obstetrics patients who are near delivery. Because of this change, you will see an increase in individuals tested for COVID-19. Kristi Hanley, Chief Quality Officer, and Bill Dickinson, Lab Director for Cogdell Memorial Hospital will discuss lab testing on the Wednesday's edition of Judge Hicks' Daily briefing.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Wear a cloth face covering to slow the spread of coronavirus. Growing evidence suggests the virus can spread:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: • Before people show symptoms (pre-symptomatic) and

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: • From people who have the virus but never show symptoms (asymptomatic).

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Cloth face coverings help prevent spread of COVID-19 in these situations. Learn more about these coverings and how you can make one:

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

iframe.aria-label: YouTube Video, Live: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott to announce small business initiative | KVUE

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: 2nd Confirmed Positive COVID-19 Case Announced in Scurry County

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: -- According to Cogdell Memorial Hospital and the Scurry County Health Unit, they have received a second confirmed positive COVID-19 test.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: This brings the total number of positive tests conducted and received in Scurry County to

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: two

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: . As is standard, the individual had been instructed to self-isolate pending results. The Health Unit immediately began an investigation.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Cogdell Memorial Hospital will provide an update on positive, negative, and pending test results daily between 1 pm - 2 pm.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The daily test count scorecard is found online at:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Scurry County Coronavirus Resource Website: scurrycovid.com

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

p.span: Scurry County United Way has partnered with SCRC to provide emergency relief to families affected by COVID-19. This program does not duplicate services that are already made available within our community. The main goal for these funds is to assist individuals and families in this time of crisis with their basic needs & ensure self-sustainability. Services are limited to: housing, medical, utilities, and food.

iframe.aria-label: YouTube Video, Scurry County COVID-19 Special Announcement

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Scurry County Announces First Presumptive Positive COVID-19 Case

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Cogdell Memorial Hospital is announcing the first positive COVID-19 case in Scurry County. The patient is a 50-60-year-old who met the screening criteria for COVID-19 upon arrival at the hospital. This individual presented with fever and shortness of breath. The patient was taken directly to the dedicated isolation room of Cogdell Memorial Hospital prior to being transferred to another hospital in stable, but serious condition. The staff who came in contact with the patient were wearing appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) throughout the time the patient was in the facility. “We are taking the identification of COVID-19 in our community very seriously,” said Dr. Bid Cooper, Local Health Authority for Scurry County. “If you haven’t been taking precautions, now is the time.”

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The Scurry County Health Unit immediately began investigating the circumstances around this case and will notify any potential close contacts. Dana Hartman, Director of Scurry County Health Unit stated, "We hope for a full recovery for this member of the community. For the health and safety of our community, we need to abide by the stay home, stay safe order. ”

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Kristi Hanley, Chief Quality Officer for Cogdell Memorial Hospital stated, “Our team is working closely with leaders from the CDC, the Texas Department of Health, and local health officials to monitor and respond to this evolving situation. We are following CDC guidelines and best practice recommendations to slow the rate of spread of COVID-19 and conserve resources in order to protect our patients, community and healthcare team and preserve our ability to deliver safe and effective care.”

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Cogdell supports Scurry County's Stay Home - Stay Safe Order directing the residents of Scurry County to stay home and limit movement outside their homes beyond what is absolutely necessary in order to reduce the risk of COVID-19 for themselves and this community. Hanley states, “We cannot emphasize enough how important it is to wash your hands frequently and to avoid any unnecessary social contact.”

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Health officials advise if you have flu and cold symptoms and suspect it may be coronavirus (COVID-19), STAY HOME and call your primary health care provider. Depending on the severity of your symptoms, they may provide special instructions or—if appropriate—make arrangements for a virtual visit. For very severe symptoms like trouble breathing, call 911.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: There are steps residents can take to prevent spread of flu and the common cold that will also help prevent coronavirus disease, including:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Washing your hands with soap and water.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Avoiding touching your eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Covering your mouth and nose with a tissue or upper sleeve when coughing or sneezing.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Avoiding contact with people who are sick.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Staying home if you are sick.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: COVID-19 Symptoms may appear in as few as two days or as long as 14 days after exposure to the virus. They include:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Fever

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Cough

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Shortness of Breath

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Community leaders have been and will continue to work together to keep our community safe and mitigate the spread of the virus,” said Dan Hicks, Scurry County Judge. “It’s crucial that our community continue to take preventative measures to lower their risk, and to share this information with their friends, family, and co-workers.”

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: This is a rapidly evolving situation. Local updates will be posted to scurrycovid.com. For CDC recommendations and updates visit and CDC.gov/Coronavirus.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: CRMWD CLOSING CAMPING AND PICNIC AREAS AT LAKES

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: April 8, 2020 – Based on directives issued by Gov. Greg Abbott and in an effort to promote public and staff health and safety during the COVID-19 pandemic, camping and picnic areas at all Colorado River Municipal Water District park areas are closed to the public effective 5:00 pm Thursday, April 9. Group shelter pavilions remain closed to the public.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The closure is in effect for all CRMWD recreational areas at Lake J.B. Thomas, E.V. Spence Reservoir and O.H. Ivie Reservoir. Boat ramps remain open at the following locations:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: LAKE J.B. THOMAS - South Side Park

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: E.V. SPENCE RESERVOIR – Paint Creek and Wildcat Parks

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: O.H. IVIE RESERVOIR – Concho, Kennedy and Padgitt Parks

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Third party operated park concessionaires located at E.V. Spence and O.H. Ivie Reservoirs are open at their discretion. Each concessionaire should be contacted for their operating hours and services provided. Concessionaire contact information is available on the CRMWD website at www.crmwd.org/recreation.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The CRMWD will continue to monitor Federal, State and Local directives to promote public health and safety for outdoor recreation activities and will announce a reopening date once it has been determined.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: For more information, please go to www.crmwd.org or contact us at 432-267-6341.

h3.div: Meals & Grocery Shopping for Scurry County Seniors

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Take out trays are served from 12:00 - 12:30 Monday through Friday while the Center is closed to activities. Pull into the south parking lot by Travis gym and a staff member will bring you a tray. Over 60, the suggested donation is $2.50. Under 60 the cost is $5.00. A good meal for a good price and you get to see a smiling face!!

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The Center, DCOS and United have teamed up to provide grocery shopping/delivery for anyone 65 or older. This has been a great service to keep the elderly from being out in the crowds at the grocery store. Just call the Center at 573-4035 in the morning and a volunteer will shop and deliver to you in the afternoon. No charge for the delivery, just pay for the groceries when they are delivered to your door. Volunteers will not be coming into your home. Groceries are place inside the door.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: This Friday is Good Friday and the Center will not be serving meals. Box lunches will be sent out for Home delivery on Thursday for Friday.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Stay safe and stay well. We promise a big welcome home party when we are given the green light to open the Center again. In the meantime, you are all in our thoughts and prayers!!

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

h3.div: FEMA Recovery Funding for Business Owners

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Business Owners in Scurry County. If you want to participate in any eventual recovery funding from FEMA, you must fill out a form for the month of March, and get it to the County Auditor's office. Additional requests for operational losses for April and any subsequent months that losses are incurred will be requested at the appropriate time, but for now, the initial form for March-2020 needs to be filled out and filed with the Auditor.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The DSO (Disaster Summary Outline) is a tool used to report to FEMA. The numbers you report do not need to be exact, however should be a good faith estimate accurately portraying your business losses/expenses related to the COVID-19 pandemic. Any numbers reported to FEMA are subject to audit, but you do not need to pay an accountant to compile the figures for these early reports, just a good faith estimate.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Regardless of the type of business you run, including farming and ranching if you have lost income/wages due to COVID-19, ALL business owners need to report if they want to participate in FEMA funding.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: DSO explanation starts at 1:30 on the video.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The DSO form is available on the County website @

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: on the home page.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Also available on the City website @

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: on the home page under "Latest News".

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Direct link to the form is:

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The form needs to be returned electronically to: covid.dso@co.scurry.tx.us OR you can mail it to Auditor, Scurry County Courthouse, 1806 25th, Snyder, Tx. 79549

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: KEEP A COPY OF EVERYTHING YOU SUBMIT!

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: It is urgently important that each business in Scurry County report to Scurry County ONLY, and submit a DSO form, otherwise your business can not be included in the cumulative report to FEMA, and your losses may not be eligible for reimbursement under the Federal Disaster Declaration.

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Oswald; font-size: 38px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: What to Do If You Are Sick

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: may show up 2‑14 days after exposure. The steps you should take if you think you are sick with COVID‑19 depend on whether you have a higher risk of developing severe illness.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: People 65 years or older, and/or people with medical issues, like heart disease, diabetes, cancer, or a weakened immune system, are at a higher risk for getting very sick from COVID‑19.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If you are a high-risk individual and you develop fever or symptoms, call your doctor.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 15px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If you are not sick enough to be hospitalized, you can recover at home. Follow your doctor's instructions and refer to

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.a: CDC recommendations for how to take care of yourself at home

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 15px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If you are in generally good health and have mild symptoms, stay home and take care of yourself like you would for a cold or the flu.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 15px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If symptoms worsen, call your doctor.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If you are sick or are caring for someone who is sick, you can use the

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: on the

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: page to help you make decisions about seeking appropriate medical care. Source: The Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS)

p.style: text-align: left;

div.p: As part of our commitment to provide consistent and clear communication with the community, Scurry County Judge, Dan Hicks, will host a COVID-19 Daily Status Briefing at 2pm Monday-Friday. The Scurry County Daily Status Briefing will be posted on this website and may also be found on the Scurry County YouTube Channel.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Paycheck Protection Program has launched. It will be processed by your local bank. There is an application online at sba.gov. If you don't want to navigate the website, then contact me and I will email it to you. 573-1544 or brooke@growsnyder.com. DO THIS TODAY!!!!

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The Treasury Department and SBA

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: about the Paycheck Protection Program. As Secretary Mnuchin

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: , "we've heard feedback from lenders, community banks, regional banks, and we've spent the last 24 hours making this system even easier. This will be up and running tomorrow."

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Per his announcement, small businesses and sole proprietorships will be able to apply for the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) starting today, a provision of the CARES Act that provides small businesses with funds to pay up to 8 weeks of payroll costs including benefits. Funds can also be used to pay interest on mortgages, rent, and utilities. The funds are provided in the form of loans that will be fully forgiven when used for payroll costs, interest on mortgages, rent, and utilities, and small businesses looking to receive them can apply through any federally insured depository institution, federally insured credit union, and Farm Credit System institution that is participating.

h3.div: Department of Labor Information Regarding COVID-19

p.style: margin-left: 40px; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Department of Labor Information Regarding COVID -19:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The U.S. Department of Labor’s Wage and Hour Division (WHD) has posted additional FAQs to the Families First Coronavirus Response Act:

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: page.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Attached is Department of Labor guidance on CARES Act unemployment benefits provisions. This is the 1

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 10.799999999999999px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: of four guidance letters the Department will send out to states. The beginning of the guidance addresses concerns that have been raised about individuals quitting their jobs and electing to go on unemployment rather than staying with their employers. Link to DOL Unemployment Insurance Guidance Letter (UIPL) 14-29

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: For more information on FFCRA’s benefits and requirements please see the WHD

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: and

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: , available in both English and Spanish. Available guidance also includes two new posters, one

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: and

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: , available in both English and Spanish, that will fulfill notice requirements for employers obligated to inform employees about their rights under this new law,

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: about posting requirements, and

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: describing WHD’s 30-day non-enforcement policy.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: WHD provides additional information on common issues employers and employees face when responding to COVID-19 and its effects on wages and hours worked under the Fair Labor Standards Act and job-protected leave under the Family and Medical Leave Act at

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/whd/pandemic.

p.style: margin-left: 40px; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: In addition to the launch of the PPP today, President Trump Treasury Secretary Mnuchin also updated the country about the progress being made to distribute Economic Impact Payments to Americans who qualify.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The President said at yesterday's briefing that Social Security recipients who do not file a tax return will not have to file one in order to receive a direct cash payment. He also said that the the Treasury Department will, "deposit the money directly into the bank accounts."

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Secretary Mnuchin

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: that he expects the first payments will be directly deposited into taxpayers' bank accounts, "within two weeks."

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: from Republicans on the House Ways & Means Committee has mores answers on the relief check program:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: : "CARES Act: Coronavirus Relief Check Questions Answered"

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Direct links to the following temporary programs (or temporary expansions of current programs) are below (including application forms):

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Paycheck Protection Program (PPP):

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 40px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

p.span: The recently passed

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.a: Corona Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (CARES act)

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: provides aid to businesses as well as individuals effected by the COVID-19 pandemic.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: We’ve outlined

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.a: key provisions of the CARES Act

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: for both individuals and businesses, including the following:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Withdrawals from retirement accounts

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: offering financial assistance to businesses effected by the COVID-19 pandemic. There are important details within this program governing the amount of potential aid available. These details require businesses and advisers to pay close attention in order to maximize the potential benefits.

p.span: this Friday, April 3 from 10-11 a.m. CDT, to learn more about how the SBA and Eide Bailly can help your business during these uncertain times.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The Texas Health and Human Services Commission (HHSC) has launched a statewide mental health support line to help Texans experiencing anxiety, stress, or other emotional challenges due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This resource offers support for all Texans and can be reached any time day or night at

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The line is operated by the

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.a: Harris Center for Mental Health and IDD

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: , and offers trauma-informed support and psychological first aid to those experiencing mental health symptoms related to COVID-19. Counseling services are confidential and free of charge.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: More information on mental health resources and your local metal health authority can be found on

font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

h3.div: Governor Abbott Orders Schools Closed Until May 4, 2020

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Governor Abbott announced that schools will remain closed until May 4, 2020 due to the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. We had prepared for this possibility and will continue with the virtual education platform we have established through the

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If you are unable to access your child’s school work online, please call 325-574-8900 or email

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: questions@snyderisd.net

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: to discuss options. We appreciate the support you have shown our staff and most of all, your support to continue your child’s education.

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: will continue as will the virtual

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: . We will continue to keep you updated and encourage you to reach out to us anytime.

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

h3.div: JETS Continues to Serve Meals & Provide Supplies

div.p: JETS continues to serve meals to enrolled children daily from 8:30-9:30. A month's supply of diapers, wipes,formula and baby food were distributed. Should the closure continue, JETS will distribute items again on April 27, 2020.

p.span: The Center and the SBDC will be co-hosting a free webinar on Tuesday, March 31, at 10:00 am. Vanda Cullar and Sonia White will be explaining the Emergency Injury Disaster Loan (EIDL) program for nonprofits and sharing the documents required. The Small Business Development Center highly encourages nonprofits to apply so that they will be in the system if/when additional emergency assistance becomes available. We will also have a Q&A session at the end if time allows.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Due to the COVID-19 outbreak, we have suspended all routine eye care until May 1st. During this time we will continue to provide urgent and emergent eye care for red eyes, vision loss, flashes and floaters, injuries, etc. by appointment only. We will also provide services to order glasses and contact lenses with limited hours, curbside pick-up, and direct shipping.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: For Urgent and Emergent care dial 325-207-3229 and our on call doctor will schedule a time to meet you at the office for care.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: We will allow 3 month extensions on contact lens prescriptions for current patients.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: For all general inquiries please call 325-574-2020 and we will return your call within 24 hours.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: For all contact lens or glasses orders please call 325-574-2020 or stop by during our limited hours listed below.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Limited Hours: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 11:30 to 12:30 and 4:30 to 5:30.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If you are below a 3 month supply of contact lenses we would encourage you to order additional contact lenses at this time. For your convenience, we are offering curbside pick-up or direct shipping at no additional charge on new orders of 2 or more boxes. For curbside pick-up, please call our office at 325-574-2020 during our limited hours and we will gladly take payment at your vehicle and bring your supply to you.
